com.android.server.power

Class PowerManagerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • IPowerManager.Stub
      • com.android.server.power.PowerManagerService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Watchdog.Monitor

    public final class PowerManagerService
extends IPowerManager.Stub
implements Watchdog.Monitor
    The power manager service is responsible for coordinating power management functions on the device.

                 LightsService ls,
                 ActivityManagerService am,

        Initialize the power manager. Must be called before any other functions within the power manager are called.

      • reboot

        public void reboot(boolean confirm,
                   java.lang.String reason,
                   boolean wait)
        Reboots the device.
        Parameters:
        confirm - If true, shows a reboot confirmation dialog.
        reason - The reason for the reboot, or null if none.
        wait - If true, this call waits for the reboot to complete and does not return.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(boolean confirm,
                     boolean wait)
        Shuts down the device.
        Parameters:
        confirm - If true, shows a shutdown confirmation dialog.
        wait - If true, this call waits for the shutdown to complete and does not return.

      • crash

        public void crash(java.lang.String message)
        Crash the runtime (causing a complete restart of the Android framework). Requires REBOOT permission. Mostly for testing. Should not return.

      • setStayOnSetting

        public void setStayOnSetting(int val)
        Set the setting that determines whether the device stays on when plugged in. The argument is a bit string, with each bit specifying a power source that, when the device is connected to that source, causes the device to stay on. See BatteryManager for the list of power sources that can be specified. Current values include BatteryManager.BATTERY_PLUGGED_AC and BatteryManager.BATTERY_PLUGGED_USB Used by "adb shell svc power stayon ..."
        Parameters:
        val - an int containing the bits that specify which power sources should cause the device to stay on.

      • setMaximumScreenOffTimeoutFromDeviceAdmin

        public void setMaximumScreenOffTimeoutFromDeviceAdmin(int timeMs)
        Used by device administration to set the maximum screen off timeout. This method must only be called by the device administration policy manager.

      • setAttentionLight

        public void setAttentionLight(boolean on,
                              int color)
        Used by the phone application to make the attention LED flash when ringing.

      • timeSinceScreenWasLastOn

        public long timeSinceScreenWasLastOn()
        Used by the Watchdog.

      • setScreenBrightnessOverrideFromWindowManager

        public void setScreenBrightnessOverrideFromWindowManager(int brightness)
        Used by the window manager to override the screen brightness based on the current foreground activity. This method must only be called by the window manager.
        Parameters:
        brightness - The overridden brightness, or -1 to disable the override.

      • setButtonBrightnessOverrideFromWindowManager

        public void setButtonBrightnessOverrideFromWindowManager(int brightness)
        Used by the window manager to override the button brightness based on the current foreground activity. This method must only be called by the window manager.
        Parameters:
        brightness - The overridden brightness, or -1 to disable the override.

      • setUserActivityTimeoutOverrideFromWindowManager

        public void setUserActivityTimeoutOverrideFromWindowManager(long timeoutMillis)
        Used by the window manager to override the user activity timeout based on the current foreground activity. It can only be used to make the timeout shorter than usual, not longer. This method must only be called by the window manager.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - The overridden timeout, or -1 to disable the override.

      • setTemporaryScreenBrightnessSettingOverride

        public void setTemporaryScreenBrightnessSettingOverride(int brightness)
        Used by the settings application and brightness control widgets to temporarily override the current screen brightness setting so that the user can observe the effect of an intended settings change without applying it immediately. The override will be canceled when the setting value is next updated.
        Parameters:
        brightness - The overridden brightness.
        See Also:
        Settings.System#SCREEN_BRIGHTNESS

      • setTemporaryScreenAutoBrightnessAdjustmentSettingOverride

        public void setTemporaryScreenAutoBrightnessAdjustmentSettingOverride(float adj)
        Used by the settings application and brightness control widgets to temporarily override the current screen auto-brightness adjustment setting so that the user can observe the effect of an intended settings change without applying it immediately. The override will be canceled when the setting value is next updated.
        Parameters:
        adj - The overridden brightness, or Float.NaN to disable the override.
        See Also:
        Settings.System#SCREEN_AUTO_BRIGHTNESS_ADJ

      • lowLevelShutdown

        public static void lowLevelShutdown()
        Low-level function turn the device off immediately, without trying to be clean. Most people should use ShutdownThread for a clean shutdown.

      • lowLevelReboot

        public static void lowLevelReboot(java.lang.String reason)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Low-level function to reboot the device.
        Parameters:
        reason - code to pass to the kernel (e.g. "recovery"), or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reboot fails for some reason (eg, lack of permission)
